ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Did the participant need the researcher to provide suggestions and help them through co-construction (e.g., asking an open-ended question, starting a sentence, encouraging the participant to continue) during the warmup exercise?
Score awarded for first narrative with attachment-related content that emphasized parent-child interactions
Notes: 1 = The narrative included almost exclusively odd content or a different theme entirely; 2 = The narrative lacked secure base content and was so short that it was disjointed; 3 = The narrative focused on actions or events with no acknowledgement of emotional states or interactions; 4 = The narrative contained minimal elements of the secure base script; 5 = The narrative contained some elements of the secure base script but was restricted in elaboration; 6 = The narrative was characterized by rich secure base script content with elaboration; 7 = The narrative was characterized by rich secure base script content with extensive elaboration

ElementDescription: Score awarded for second narrative with attachment-related content that emphasized parent-child interactions
Notes: 1 = The narrative included almost exclusively odd content or a different theme entirely; 2 = The narrative lacked secure base content and was so short that it was disjointed; 3 = The narrative focused on actions or events with no acknowledgement of emotional states or interactions; 4 = The narrative contained minimal elements of the secure base script; 5 = The narrative contained some elements of the secure base script but was restricted in elaboration; 6 = The narrative was characterized by rich secure base script content with elaboration; 7 = The narrative was characterized by rich secure base script content with extensive elaboration

ElementDescription: Mean score awarded for narratives that emphasized parent-child interactions

ElementDescription: Mean score awarded for narratives that emphasized peer-to-peer interactions
Mean score awarded for all narratives that emphasized parent-child and peer-to-peer interactions
Notes: Mean of sbst_parent_1_score, sbst_parent_2_score, sbst_peer_1_score, and sbst_peer_2_score
